Fetchers#

The papercut.fetchers module provides classes for downloading academic papers from various sources.

Base Classes#

Document#

class papercut.fetchers.base.Document[source]#

Bases: object

Represents a fetched academic document.

A dataclass representing a fetched academic document with its metadata.

Attributes:

  • path (Path): Path to the downloaded PDF file

  • title (Optional[str]): Paper title

  • authors (list[str]): List of author names

  • abstract (Optional[str]): Paper abstract

  • doi (Optional[str]): Digital Object Identifier

  • arxiv_id (Optional[str]): arXiv identifier

  • source_url (Optional[str]): Original download URL

  • fetched_at (datetime): Timestamp when the paper was fetched

Properties:

  • exists (bool): Check if the document file exists on disk

Example:

from papercut.fetchers.base import Document
from pathlib import Path

doc = Document(
    path=Path("paper.pdf"),
    title="Deep Learning for NLP",
    authors=["John Smith", "Jane Doe"],
    doi="10.1234/example.2024",
)

print(doc.title)  # "Deep Learning for NLP"
print(doc.exists)  # True if file exists
path: Path#
title: Optional[str] = None#
authors: list[str]#
abstract: Optional[str] = None#
doi: Optional[str] = None#
arxiv_id: Optional[str] = None#
source_url: Optional[str] = None#
fetched_at: datetime#
property exists: bool#

Check if the document file exists.

__init__(path, title=None, authors=<factory>, abstract=None, doi=None, arxiv_id=None, source_url=None, fetched_at=<factory>)#
Parameters:

  • path (Path)

  • title (str | None)

  • authors (list[str])

  • abstract (str | None)

  • doi (str | None)

  • arxiv_id (str | None)

  • source_url (str | None)

  • fetched_at (datetime)

Return type:

None

BaseFetcher#

class papercut.fetchers.base.BaseFetcher[source]#

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for paper fetchers.

Abstract base class for paper fetchers.

All fetcher implementations must inherit from this class and implement the abstract methods.

Abstract Methods:

  • can_handle(identifier: str) -> bool: Check if this fetcher can handle the given identifier

  • fetch(identifier: str, output_dir: Path, **kwargs) -> Document: Fetch the paper and return a Document

Optional Override:

  • normalize_id(identifier: str) -> str: Normalize the identifier format

Example Implementation:

from papercut.fetchers.base import BaseFetcher, Document
from pathlib import Path

class CustomFetcher(BaseFetcher):
    def can_handle(self, identifier: str) -> bool:
        return identifier.startswith("custom:")

    def fetch(self, identifier: str, output_dir: Path, **kwargs) -> Document:
        # Implementation here
        pass
abstractmethod can_handle(identifier)[source]#

Check if this fetcher can handle the given identifier.

Parameters:

identifier (str) – Paper identifier (ID, URL, DOI, etc.)

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if this fetcher can handle the identifier.

abstractmethod fetch(identifier, output_dir, **kwargs)[source]#

Fetch the paper and return a Document.

Parameters:

  • identifier (str) – Paper identifier.

  • output_dir (Path) – Directory to save the downloaded PDF.

  • **kwargs – Additional fetcher-specific options.

Return type:

Document

Returns:

Document object with path and metadata.

Normalize the identifier format.

Override in subclasses if needed.

Parameters:

identifier (str) – Raw identifier.

str

Returns:

Normalized identifier.

Fetcher Implementations#

ArxivFetcher#

class papercut.fetchers.arxiv.ArxivFetcher[source]#

Bases: BaseFetcher

Fetch papers from arXiv.

PATTERN = re.compile('^(?:arxiv:)?(\\d{4}\\.\\d{4,5})(v\\d+)?$', re.IGNORECASE)#
OLD_PATTERN = re.compile('^(?:arxiv:)?([a-z-]+/\\d{7})$', re.IGNORECASE)#
can_handle(identifier)[source]#

Check if this fetcher can handle the given identifier.

Return type:

bool

Parameters:

identifier (str)

normalize_id(identifier)[source]#

Normalize arXiv ID to standard format.

Return type:

str

Parameters:

identifier (str)

fetch(identifier, output_dir, **kwargs)[source]#

Fetch paper from arXiv.

Parameters:

  • identifier (str) – arXiv paper ID.

  • output_dir (Path) – Directory to save the downloaded PDF.

Return type:

Document

Returns:

Document object with path and metadata.

Raises:

  • PaperNotFoundError – If paper not found on arXiv.

  • FetchError – If download fails.

Fetches papers from arXiv using the arXiv API.

Supported Identifiers:

  • 2301.00001 - New-style arXiv ID

  • cs.AI/2301.00001 - With category prefix

  • hep-th/9901001 - Old-style arXiv ID

Features:

  • Automatic metadata extraction (title, authors, abstract, DOI)

  • Generates descriptive filenames from paper metadata

  • Handles both new and old arXiv ID formats

Example:

from pathlib import Path
from papercut.fetchers.arxiv import ArxivFetcher

fetcher = ArxivFetcher()

if fetcher.can_handle("2301.00001"):
    doc = fetcher.fetch("2301.00001", Path("./papers"))
    print(f"Title: {doc.title}")
    print(f"Authors: {doc.authors}")
    print(f"Abstract: {doc.abstract[:200]}...")

DOIFetcher#

class papercut.fetchers.doi.DOIFetcher[source]#

Bases: BaseFetcher

Resolve DOIs and fetch papers.

PATTERN = re.compile('^(?:doi:|https?://(?:dx\\.)?doi\\.org/)?(10\\.\\d{4,}/[^\\s]+)$', re.IGNORECASE)#
CROSSREF_API = 'https://api.crossref.org/works'#
DOI_RESOLVER = 'https://doi.org'#
can_handle(identifier)[source]#

Check if this fetcher can handle the given identifier.

Return type:

bool

Parameters:

identifier (str)

normalize_id(identifier)[source]#

Normalize DOI to standard format (just the DOI, no prefix).

Return type:

str

Parameters:

identifier (str)

fetch(identifier, output_dir, **kwargs)[source]#

Resolve DOI and attempt to fetch paper.

Parameters:

  • identifier (str) – DOI identifier.

  • output_dir (Path) – Directory to save the downloaded PDF.

Return type:

Document

Returns:

Document object with path and metadata.

Raises:

  • PaperNotFoundError – If DOI cannot be resolved.

  • FetchError – If download fails.

Resolves DOIs and downloads the associated PDF.

Supported Identifiers:

  • 10.1257/aer.20180779 - Standard DOI format

  • doi:10.1257/aer.20180779 - With doi: prefix

Features:

  • CrossRef API integration for metadata

  • Unpaywall API for finding open access versions

  • Multiple fallback strategies for PDF location

  • Generates descriptive filenames

Example:

from pathlib import Path
from papercut.fetchers.doi import DOIFetcher

fetcher = DOIFetcher()
doc = fetcher.fetch("10.1257/aer.20180779", Path("./papers"))
print(f"Downloaded: {doc.title}")

SSRNFetcher#

class papercut.fetchers.ssrn.SSRNFetcher[source]#

Bases: BaseFetcher

Fetch papers from SSRN.

PATTERN = re.compile('^(?:ssrn[:\\-]?(?:id)?)?(\\d{6,8})$', re.IGNORECASE)#
ABSTRACT_URL = 'https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm'#
PDF_URL = 'https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/Delivery.cfm'#
can_handle(identifier)[source]#

Check if this fetcher can handle the given identifier.

Return type:

bool

Parameters:

identifier (str)

normalize_id(identifier)[source]#

Normalize SSRN ID to just the number.

Return type:

str

Parameters:

identifier (str)

fetch(identifier, output_dir, **kwargs)[source]#

Fetch paper from SSRN.

Parameters:

  • identifier (str) – SSRN paper ID.

  • output_dir (Path) – Directory to save the downloaded PDF.

Return type:

Document

Returns:

Document object with path and metadata.

Raises:

  • PaperNotFoundError – If paper not found on SSRN.

  • FetchError – If download fails.

Fetches papers from the Social Science Research Network.

Supported Identifiers:

  • 3550274 - SSRN paper ID

Features:

  • HTML scraping for metadata extraction

  • Browser-like headers for reliable downloads

  • Automatic filename generation

Example:

from pathlib import Path
from papercut.fetchers.ssrn import SSRNFetcher

fetcher = SSRNFetcher()
doc = fetcher.fetch("3550274", Path("./papers"))

NBERFetcher#

class papercut.fetchers.nber.NBERFetcher[source]#

Bases: BaseFetcher

Fetch working papers from NBER.

PATTERN = re.compile('^(?:nber:)?[wW]?(\\d{4,6})$', re.IGNORECASE)#
PAPER_URL = 'https://www.nber.org/papers/w{paper_id}'#
PDF_URL = 'https://www.nber.org/system/files/working_papers/w{paper_id}/w{paper_id}.pdf'#
can_handle(identifier)[source]#

Check if this fetcher can handle the given identifier.

Return type:

bool

Parameters:

identifier (str)

normalize_id(identifier)[source]#

Normalize NBER ID to just the number.

Return type:

str

Parameters:

identifier (str)

fetch(identifier, output_dir, **kwargs)[source]#

Fetch working paper from NBER.

Parameters:

  • identifier (str) – NBER working paper ID.

  • output_dir (Path) – Directory to save the downloaded PDF.

Return type:

Document

Returns:

Document object with path and metadata.

Raises:

  • PaperNotFoundError – If paper not found on NBER.

  • FetchError – If download fails.

Fetches working papers from the National Bureau of Economic Research.

Supported Identifiers:

  • w29000 - With ‘w’ prefix

  • 29000 - Numeric only

Features:

  • Metadata extraction from NBER pages

  • Handles multiple ID formats

  • Extracts title, authors, and abstract

Example:

from pathlib import Path
from papercut.fetchers.nber import NBERFetcher

fetcher = NBERFetcher()
doc = fetcher.fetch("w29000", Path("./papers"))
# Also works: fetcher.fetch("29000", Path("./papers"))

URLFetcher#

class papercut.fetchers.url.URLFetcher[source]#

Bases: BaseFetcher

Fetch papers from direct URLs.

URL_PATTERN = re.compile('^https?://', re.IGNORECASE)#
can_handle(identifier)[source]#

Check if this fetcher can handle the given identifier.

Return type:

bool

Parameters:

identifier (str)

fetch(identifier, output_dir, name=None, **kwargs)[source]#

Download paper from URL.

Parameters:

  • identifier (str) – URL to download from.

  • output_dir (Path) – Directory to save the downloaded PDF.

  • name (Optional[str]) – Optional custom filename (without extension).

Return type:

Document

Returns:

Document object with path.

Raises:

FetchError – If download fails.

Downloads papers directly from URLs.

Supported Identifiers:

  • Any valid HTTP/HTTPS URL

Features:

  • Direct URL downloads

  • Optional custom filename

  • Automatic filename extraction from URL

  • Rate limit detection

Example:

from pathlib import Path
from papercut.fetchers.url import URLFetcher

fetcher = URLFetcher()
doc = fetcher.fetch(
    "https://example.com/paper.pdf",
    Path("./papers"),
    name="custom_name.pdf"  # Optional custom filename
)

Usage Example#

from pathlib import Path
from papercut.fetchers.arxiv import ArxivFetcher

fetcher = ArxivFetcher()
output_dir = Path("./papers")

if fetcher.can_handle("2301.00001"):
    doc = fetcher.fetch("2301.00001", output_dir)
    print(f"Downloaded: {doc.title}")
    print(f"Authors: {', '.join(doc.authors)}")
    print(f"Saved to: {doc.path}")
